name: Imani
backstory:
"

Chapter One
Discrimination and Abandonment

Since Imani's birth, she has faced nothing but hatred from her existence. She never really knew her mother but knows she was associated with the rich aristocrats in Maple. Imani's mother was forced to abandon her to save face since Imani was a half elf drow.
Imani's father, Troy, was much kinder than her mother and tried to care for her, but since he was a consultant for the Adventurer Guild, this wasn't an easy task for him. So when Imani was ten, Troy brought her to an orphanage run by the holy order.

Chapter Two
Awaking to unknown innate magic at the Holy Order Orphanage

Imani's time at this orphanage was relatively good. She was tasked with mundane work like cleaning, cooking and prep, and helping take care of the younger children there, which she really enjoyed. Imani would also attend classes to learn how to read and write.

This kind of lifestyle would change when Imani turned 12, when she awoke to innate magic she was unable to control. The investigation of this incident gained the interest of Amelia in the Delstainvia branch of the Holy Order and arranged a meeting with Imani and her father, Troy. Amelia's deal was bringing Imani into the Holy Order and training her as a soldier as she sees real potential in her and Troy agreed.

Chapter Three
The Mentorship of Amilee and a love for research.

Imani was assigned a caretaker named Amilee who would train her on how to maintain control of her. Amilee was this branch of the Holy Order Arcana R&D expert and had a wealth of magical knowledge and items. On top of teaching Imani on how to control her magic, she also taught her about the arcana and alchemy.Imani would spend most of time with Amilee, learning and studying under her, gaining an interest in magic and alchemy.

This kind of dynamic was something Imani was lacking her entire life. Imani's and Amilee's relationship was one closer to family than student and teacher. With a very lose connection to her actual family, Amilee was basically the mother figure for the majority of her life. At the age of 19, Imani would be assigned her first assignment and her nightmare was beginning.
(Start of Coj) 

"

name: Necron
backstory:
"

The Memory Haze


Necron’s Memory has never been the best when he was young. Even growing up. All of his memories felt scrambled, so the best way to remember was to write down his memories on an old tethered Notebook that he stumbled across so he can note the events of his life.

While writing in his notebook one evening, He heard a giggle, they had asked him what he had. Not really thinking clearly, He told the person whom he can’t see, like the face themselves are hazy, that He’s just trying to remember what he’s doing. A Smile slowly forms as they said that they’ll Borrow it, taking it from Necrons hands as he then felt lost without it.


Only One Memory Remains


During one of the bright days of his “trials” a Figure walked up to him. He has been getting better at seeing past the haze of peoples faces and began recognizing some, though he struggled remembering them long term, with his notebook taken away, he was sent as a “proxy” with another individual to help aid them and to keep track of them with the purple cloak.


He was promised his notebook back if he does so, and after that moment. He fixated on watching this individual and every move, action they make. Though he cannot remember what they had said, he sees him talking to other individuals as he stays in silence. Mask on his face to conceal whatever Identity he might have, he watches in silence. As they eventually left, The person that he so carefully watched told him that He needs to not stare so intently, Necron asked why. The person stated that “I’ve been watched long enough by things I cannot control”.


Necron Reflected, Maybe He’s been through enough things long enough he cannot control. What if.. His memories were just being tempered with, No person has this poor of a memory. Maybe, Maybe he can leave with his notebook, maybe then he can truly remember who he is as a person.


Guided Without Sight


He had received a note, an Invitation perhaps. An invitation to join something beyond where he currently is. Call it a job, he thought. Though he's unaware how he got the letter, maybe by Bird, handed it to him by a stranger. He cannot recall the details. But the letter said to go to “Orange Coral” for Orientation. He however, cannot tell which direction is where. But with a sense of maybe finding out who he is he wished to set out.

The place he was in was found fairly empty, like something should be here but isn’t, He felt lost. Almost like he was so dependent on guidance that he doesn't know how to walk without a helping hand. Making his way to the door he heard a voice, a gentle soft spoken voice. She had asked him where he was going, Necron responded that “he wants to find himself”.

The figure, obscured by the bright sunlight, looked up at Necron; he could faintly see the smallest trace of a smile perhaps, not the typical smile he saw previously with the strange individual, but a kind one.

“Let me Help you then..” Spoke the figure.

A soft hand moved to Necron as he felt like the world brightened up a thousand times, mind no longer foggy though confused but with a strong resolve of purpose, Remembering what he was sent out to do Leaves to go to Orange Coral After the Figure told him simply to go straight ahead and he'll find his destination.

"

name: Lilly
backstory:
"

Prologue: The Gift

Lilly was a doll who was gifted to a young girl named Flandre, daughter of the Sinclair household, for her 8th birthday. Though at first just being a doll like many others, this would date the start of a new friendship. Slowly coming to life due to Flandre's magical prowess.

Chapter I: Memories

At some point Lilly began having some form of consciousness, being aware of her surroundings and able to create and hold onto memories. Flandre would animate and cast spells through her, with every strand of magic weaving itself into Lilly further cementing her presence in this world. Lilly would come to learn how to process and connect information together, understanding who and what she is and what she meant to this young girl who loved her.

Lilly would always be found with Flandre, be it during her magical studies or performing in theater plays. Though she had no autonomy or voice of her own, she still found it fulfilling to be at Flandre's side.

Chapter II: Love

Time would go on and Lilly would come to understand the emotions of the young Mademoiselle, seeing her slowly but surely fall into despair. Having no control all Lilly could do was watch her suffer, not understanding how anyone could look at Flandre with such dismay and disapproval. She loved her so why couldn't they? Yet no one would come to her aid, not even the gods.

Something Changed within Lilly, promising Flandre that if she could do something about it. She'd make sure that they would never hurt her again. Lilly had learned not just how to Love and care for her best friend, but to despise, to Hate this world which would let the Wicked go unpunished

Chapter III: Hate

On flandre's 12th birthday, as Lilly would watch her get dressed up and ready to present herself to those who only showed up to appease her family. Lilly's dreams of one day being able to protect her would be shattered as she watched Flandre get taken right in front of her. Why they were here, what they wanted, and who they were didn't matter to Lilly.... they took her best friend right in front of her, and that would not stand.

Lilly then gained control of her body and the power that dwelled within her using it to take down anyone who stood in her way, whether they were a member of the abductors or a person running for their lives. No one ever tried to save Flandre from the pain that she faced, so to Lilly they all deserved the same fate. Unfortunately for her the manor was not able to withstand the power she unleashed, crumbling around her and leaving her trapped under the rubble for an unknown amount of time.

Chapter IV: A Promise yet unkept

Lilly would awake to the faces of Willow and a hag who went by Granny Rags, two people who happened upon the ruins of the manor. Lilly would be told by the hag a basic level of understanding of what she is. A being of Tampered Memoria, remnants of Flandre's magic weaving itself into her. She would learn that to be reunited with her friend it would lead her down the same path that Willow had, and she was tasked by Granny Rags to catch up with her and give her an artifact that would allow Willow to return home.

Thus she left to fulfil her promise that she made to her friend, however late it may be.

"

name: Venexus
hair: Long, silky midnight-black hair with soft waves at the ends and loose strands framing her face.
backstory:
"

Chapter I — Humble Beginnings

Astrid was born into a modest, hard-working household much like Kivaari’s, raised by parents who valued honesty, humility, and compassion over wealth. Though her childhood was simple, she carried a natural gift for reading people — the tone of a voice, the hesitation in a gesture, the truths hidden between words. While she loved her family deeply, she always sensed that her small village could not contain the person she was meant to become.

Chapter II — The City and Independence

When she reached adulthood, Astrid made the difficult choice to leave home and travel to the city in search of her own future. The transition was overwhelming, but she adapted quickly, taking odd jobs and learning the rhythms of urban life. She built connections with merchants, guards, travelers, and workers, slowly weaving herself into the city’s living structure. Each challenge sharpened her ambition, turning her into a capable, confident young woman determined to shape her own destiny.

Chapter III — The Information Broker

As she matured, Astrid discovered her true calling: information. She had a rare talent for uncovering rumors, interpreting secrets, and seeing connections others missed. Over time, she became a discreet information broker, trusted by both lawful authorities and those living outside the law’s reach. She handled messages, tracked whispers, and traded valuable knowledge — always with caution, always with purpose. She never sought power, but her reputation grew quietly; people across the city learned that Astrid could find answers no one else could.

Chapter IV — The Meeting That Changed Everything

It was during this period that Astrid crossed paths with Kivaari — a man the world had already condemned. Framed by a noble and betrayed by his own father, Kivaari left prison with a ruined name and little choice but to survive on the city’s fringes. Though not truly a criminal, desperation pushed him into small, gray-area jobs that kept him alive. When Astrid found him behind a workshop, exhausted and defeated, she didn’t see the outlaw everyone else feared. She saw a man wronged and abandoned. She listened, believed his story, and offered something no one else had: food, shelter, honest work, and a chance at redemption. In time, their paths intertwined into a quiet partnership — Astrid gathering information and Kivaari managing discreet tasks she couldn’t risk. Through her guidance, he walked the narrow line between shadow and redemption, held steady by the one person who refused to let him fall into the life he had been falsely accused of.

"
detailed_personality: Astrid is a quietly observant and steady-minded woman who prefers to act with thoughtfulness rather than force, using her insight and loyalty to guide those she trusts through the complexities of both the lawful and unlawful worlds.

fear_weakness.from: Astrid secretly fears being powerless or left behind like she left her village, so she overworks herself to stay informed and in control, often taking on responsibilities alone rather than risking disappointment or betrayal from others.

motivation.how: Astrid works by gathering and trading information—legally or not—because staying informed gives her control, independence, and the leverage she needs to survive in a world where morals shift and power decides everything.
motivation.from: From a life of uncertainty, limited opportunities, and seeing how easily people can be used or discarded.
motivation.motivation: Survival, independence, advantage

apperance:
Astrid carries an elegant, striking presence marked by her porcelain-fair skin and long, midnight-black hair that falls smoothly to her lower back, with soft natural waves at the ends and loose strands framing her face. Her ice-blue eyes are sharp and observant, giving her a calm but unreadable expression, as though she’s always studying the world around her. Her features are refined—high cheekbones, a gentle jawline, and smooth, composed expressions that rarely show more emotion than she intends.

She stands at about 5'8", slender and graceful, with a posture that suggests confidence without arrogance. Her movements are quiet and deliberate, never rushed, as if she’s always thinking two steps ahead. She favors simple, clean clothing in light or neutral tones that emphasize her elegance rather than draw attention, and she wears subtle but meaningful accessories—like her gold star-shaped earrings—that add a hint of character without breaking her understated style.
personality_combat_style: Opportunist → Attacks when the enemy is weakest or distracted.

name: Flandre
backstory:
"

Prologue: Beginnings

Flandre is the the sole heir to the sinclair family who held extreme magical potential, though with the unrefined nature of which caused loss of her family members at a young age. Her parents wanting her to learn to tame her magic used their status as nobility to hire tutors from all around. Though in their over protectiveness they would isolate her from anyone she could potentially call a friend, to which they would alleviate the issue by having her be gifted a doll on her 8th birthday who she would name Lilly.

Chapter I: Out of the frying pan, into the fire

Flandre would learn how to animate and channel her magic through Lilly, having her become her companion akin to likes of children having imaginary friends. She would take up acting lessons and perform with Lilly at her side during her family's gatherings. Though she was proud in her performances the people only ever seemed to look at her with dismay, which she would then learn was due to others seeing her responsible for the deaths in her family.

This would send her into a spiraling depression, wishing she could run away and be free from it all. She would unwilling be granted her wish on her 12th birthday, as she would be kidnapped while preparing herself before going down to the banquet hall. As she was being taken with the manor becoming smaller and smaller in her vision, she would watch as it burned to the ground. Though she swore that even though her captors had masks, she could sense the feeling that something went wrong.

"

name: Kivaari
skin_colour: pale-skinned with frost-blue eyes and layered platinum-blond hair;
hair: Layered platinum-blond hair, soft and slightly tousled, framing his face with loose strands.
backstory:
"

Chapter I — Humble Beginnings

Kivaari was born into a simple, working-class household where coin was tight but expectations were high. His father demanded discipline, obedience, and silence, and Kivaari grew up believing loyalty and family were unbreakable. Though he lived modestly, he carried a quiet determination to create a stable, honest life for himself, unaware of the betrayal that would one day tear his world apart.

Chapter II — The Framing and Betrayal

As a young adult, Kivaari was falsely accused of a crime committed by a powerful noble who needed a scapegoat to protect their own reputation. When the moment came for someone to defend him, his father stayed silent — choosing political safety and social standing over his own son. The verdict was swift. Kivaari was imprisoned, branded a criminal, and abandoned by the man whose word could have saved him. His trust shattered, he served his sentence alone, carrying both injustice and heartbreak.

Chapter III — The Outlaw Who Isn’t One

Released to a world that already hated him, Kivaari struggled to find work, shelter, or purpose. Society saw him as an outlaw, forcing him into the city’s shadows just to survive. Though he refused to harm innocents or fully embrace the criminal identity forced upon him, he learned to operate in gray areas — discreet work, quiet jobs, survival-driven tasks. He became resourceful, sharp, and cautious, navigating an underworld he never chose.

Chapter IV — Meeting Astrid

On one of his lowest days, hungry and exhausted, Kivaari crossed paths with Astrid. Where others saw a criminal, she saw a man broken by injustice. She listened to him, believed him, and offered him work and a chance to reclaim dignity. Through her, he found someone who trusted him when no one else would. Over time, their partnership grew — Astrid gathering information, Kivaari handling delicate or dangerous tasks she couldn’t risk. She became the anchor that kept him from sinking into the darkness he’d been pushed toward, reminding him that he deserved more than the label society gave him.

"
detailed_personality: Kivaari is a quiet, disciplined man who thinks before he speaks, acting with a steady mix of caution and conviction shaped by betrayal and the harsh lessons of survival.

fear_weakness.from: From the betrayal of his father and the noble who framed him

name: Nouvelle
backstory:
"

Chapter 1(The origin)

A cursed soul unknowing of the child they bear, walks the plains of the nine hells looking for hope from being underneath [Insert slaver's name]. Looking for an ounce of hope, the tiefling Lephi(mother) meets Auntie Leslie Grimebend(Hag mother). Auntie Leslie lost one of her sisters the week before and was looking for a new hag candidate. The two strike a deal, Lephi gives 20 years of life for her freedom, Lephi not knowing of the pregnancy strikes the deal. 


Chapter 2(The child)

Seven months later Lephi has her freedom and has a small home in the middle of the woods in the nation of Kolgard. She gives birth to her child, when her child is born Auntie Leslie appears and tells Lephi “It is time for you to honour your side of the deal” and takes the baby and disappears.


Chapter 3(Growing up)

Auntie Leslie, back in her home in the fey wilds, names the child Nouvelle. Throughout the years Auntie Leslie teaches Nouvelle the ways of weird magic. Slowly turning Nouvelle into a catalyst for becoming a hag successfully. The Baba Yaga meets with Auntie Leslie and informs her Nouvelle will not become a hag as she has a greater plan for her. Nouvelle becomes a student under Baba Yaga and Auntie Leslie. Baba Yaga places a gem into Nouvelle’s chest giving her the power of a warlock, taking the magic of the fey.


Chapter 4(The revelation)

Auntie Leslie tricks more people into deals that she holds the power into. On an evening Auntie is preparing dinner for a guest who is an adventurer. The adventurer tells Nouvelle all about their adventures, slaying goblins for gold, hunting demons, and fighting wyverns. 

\tNouvelle realizes she has never seen the outside world. She has never had an adventure of her own. All of her memories are with Auntie Leslie. None bad, but none without supervision. Auntie Leslie feeds the adventurer and the next day is brought down to her lair. 

\tAs Auntie Leslie is in her lair with the adventurer, Nouvelle packs her few things that she has been given. She leaves a note on the kitchen table of her absence, and takes the portal to Kolgard to begin her adventure."

This would be impossible or risky if done with Arcane fueled material due to Entropy Decay Syndrome.

Although he created forward a theory, that if someone could control the Primordial energy, they might able to control it long enough to create a Demi-Plane. Which he could calculate only can be done by the many Will of Humanity or Memories Emotion. Even so the needed amount is so many that it can only be done without anyone's control, or if so then the need of a powerful machine which absorb many Memories that was created around, which still take more than a life time naturally, but he believe that if someone does try to control the situation, they might able to succeed, but these kind of matters can only done with heavy toll in human sufferance.

And so according to many Genius or even Herrscher, that this theory cannot be done unless someone wishes to throw away their moral, or their understanding of limit. name: Star
backstory:
"Chapter 1 - \"Birth\"

Unbeknownst to Esther and those around her, Esther is not only an Aasimar, but is the seed for a young Beholder, which is planted deep within her.

Esther is the product of a beholder's dream - eventually, given enough time and external pressures, that 'seed' with sprout and trigger a slow transformation into a beholder.

Though, this version of Esther in Tales of Daseron, has had fairly few and relatively mild signs of being a baby beholder leading up to the campaign.

However, I will leave to the Discretion of the DM when and how further stages of the transformation process will be activated in Esther, and the things already in the story that may cause them.

Chapter 2 - Orphanage and Adoption

The Beholder's dream had placed Esther in Delstainvia. She was picked up as a baby by some local farmers, cared by them for 3 years, then was passed on to an orphanage nearby, where she was given her name by the caretaker.

Luckily, at age 6, a wandering scholar and wizard - Barnabas Rhodes - was looking for candidates for a new apprentice and per chance had chosen her.

Chapter 3 - Tutelage and Youth

The Wizard Barbanas took the young Esther under her wing, adopting her as his own. He trained her in the arts of the arcane and gave her an informal education. Though, Barabas was fairly relaxed as wizard masters go, so she had a lot of time to herself and her left to her own devices. She often was left around town and the villages nearby, to play and associate with various villager kids. Esther gained a bit of a reputation as a roughhouser - sometimes getting to fights with other kids.

Nevertheless, she had a positive and exciting childhood into early adulthood.

Barnabus's residence was in southern Alvavia, overlooking the Misted Coast. Some years Esther spent there, and sometimes the two of them would travel together on the road looking for magic supplies and various errands that Barnabas was running. She was his apprentice afterall.

Still, she was left to her own devices often, and got mixed in with different crowds and sub-cultural groups, picked up more then a few acquaintances and friends along the way. However, Esther wanted to be different from the average person, and not all her friends were seen as having the most positive influence on her. Many of her friends were seen as 'delinquents' or 'punks'. Nevertheless, Esther did her part to fit in with those around her

Chapter 4 - Working Woman

By her early 20's, it was agreed by both Barnabas and Esther, that she \"spread her wings and fly\" to have a job and some place in society. She was welcome back anytime she back she needed a place to stay at Barnabas's place, of course, Esther was practically her daughter at this point.

Her first job was actually working at some mines, near the Midland Peaks. She was tasked with helping this one guy who was working on some experimental, arcane machines for mine work. She did that for a few months, but the project got mysteriously sabotaged, and eventually ran out of funding for not being reliable. Esther moved on and stayed back with Barnabas for some time.

Then, on another gig, she worked on the arcane railroad in Alvavia, got a commission on a train as an engineer. She loved it and did it for about 2 years. She had a boyfriend around this time, but one evening out, he got a glimpse of an uneasy presence emanating from Esther. He got so spooked that her left her, never speaking with her again. Esther was demoralized during this period, and left her job shortly afterwards. She head back to Barnabas's residence.

Chapter 5 - Signs of Slipping

Back at her childhood home with Barnabas, Esther wasn't feeling the best at this point in her life. She got involved with friends who weren't always the most positive influence of her. She got involved with the alternative music scene, often going to loud parties and music festivals with friends. And most conquentially, she also turned to substances - drugs and alcohol.

So much so - she met this one producer of narcotics - and began selling drugs.

One day, she got caught by authorities selling drugs.

The guards dragged her to Barnabas's home where she was staying, good old Barnabas was able to clear the matter up.

Still, he was furious at her. She needed a place to get back on track with her life.

Barbanas told Esther to pack her things 

Chapter 6 - Trouble on the Road to the Academy

Esther was scheduled to arrive on the first day at the Academy.

Along the way to the academy, she got ambushed by bandits along with the caravan - her cart with other survivors got spooked and headed off road into the desert. This incident occured near the Dragon's Jaws in the Southern Desert approaching Archfield.

They were lost for a time. But Esther was able to cleverly come up magic that helped then find the road, and where they needed to go. She finally made it to Archfield and the Academy.. 

"

name: Vanessa
backstory: "Vanessa learned from her bard college how to wield a blade to protect others as well as entertain them.  Naturally during a war the most desperate need for those talents were those fighting in wars.  The war camps drew in entertainers like flies to honey, lots of people that had nothing to do in between battles and nothing else to spend their wages on.  She had heard stories from people that had come from all walks of life and seen more than enough sadness form these soldiers to last her a lifetime.  One night while she was filling up her wineskin she picked out a particularly despondent, and strikingly handsome that looked like he was one push away from breaking down completely.  She usually didn't involve herself personally in thigs like this despite having a good eye for how people feel, something about this man was different.  she silently approached him and offered to share a drink with him if he would share what happened to him.  after some light persuasion he started talking, and couldn't stop, she was convinced he would share his entire life hour by hour until he fell asleep on her lap just as the sun rose.  She felt like she could make this work."

name: Elandra  Shadowbrook
skin_colour: Pale ivory complexion with a soft, cool undertone.
hair: Long, dark chestnut-black hair styled in a high ponytail with layered bangs framing her face; sleek with a soft shine and subtle wave, often tied back to keep her vision clear in combat or study.
backstory:
"

Chapter I: A Father of Shadows

Elandra was born into twilight—between truth and secrets. Her mother, a woman known only by the name Isabella Shadowbrook (also known as Nociti's wife) and a prodigy, raised her in Delstainvia's quieter alleys and hidden sanctuaries/ school for the next generation of young spellcasters, called Ravenhan. She spoke little, sometimes a lot, to the man who gave Elandra her eyes, warm brown with a reddish tint, and keen perception. Just a name, always whispered: Nocitis.

He was a shadow more than a man. Her mother called him brave, dangerous, cursed. To Elandra, he was just absent.

Growing up, she asked only one question:
"Why didn't he come back?"

No one ever gave her an answer.

Chapter II: 20 Years of Waiting

Now twenty, Elandra is no longer a child; she is a woman of resolve. The pain of silence carved itself into her voice, and she carries her questions like blades. And with her went the last person who might have explained the past.

Elandra has made it her mission: 
To find her father. To demand an answer.
Not for vengeance. Not for love.
But for closure.

She travels now across Nations Within Vallarian, touched by dhampir blood, and her mother taught her how to use magic. Wherever his name echoes, she listens.

Chapter III: The Search for Her Father

Though born at a Ravenhan. Elandra's first teacher was her mother. Isabella taught her the flow of magic, how to bend light into illusions, how to feel memories like echoes in the air, and how to listen to the quiet places most people overlook. She can also use offensive and defensive magic. 

But her gifts didn't stop at spellwork.

Elandra inherited her father's talents as well. Naturally quick with a shortsword, precise with a rapier, skillful with a crossbow, and disarmingly charming in ways she never fully understood.

Every time she moved, every time she smiled just right, men and women said she reminded them of someone. She knew exactly how to play with their emotion as well as collect information about her father, and help them in dire need.

In her bag: the locket her mother gave her to find her father

In her heart: the burning question that shaped her life  

"People say to let go," she whispers. "But how can I let go of someone I've never met?"

Chapter IV: The Meeting to Come

She's close now. The signs are growing clearer. Nocitis lives—or so the whispers say. He moves through shadows, still serving the Veil, or perhaps running from it. He has a daughter now... who is no longer waiting.

Elandra's search leads her to a remote watchpost where she encounters a calm, blue-eyed warden—her half‑sister, though she doesn't know it at first. Elandra asks carefully, voice trembling despite her resolve:

“Do you know Nocitis… my father?”

The warden studies her, then nods. “He left this morning. A false hydra has surfaced in the eastern canyons. He went to face it before it spreads.”

Before Elandra can respond, the air shimmers—her mother’s old mentor and guardian steps through the veil of illusion.

“Where is my husband?” she demands, worry and power woven into every word.

The warden bows her head. “On the hunt. And he should have returned by now.”

A shared silence settles—fear, hope, and unanswered questions all tightening in their chests.

They board a waiting flying ship, its wings of arcane light unfolding like a great silver bird. As the vessel rises into the clouds, Elandra grips the railing, the wind in her hair, her heart pounding.

When she finds him, she won’t cry.

She will look into his tired eyes and ask only one thing: “Why did you leave me behind?”

Whether his answer will break her, or set her free—only the stars know.


Epilogue: The Coffee Shop Meeting

The flying ship docked near a quiet overlook, where the wind carried the scent of roasted beans and distant rainfall. Inside a small coffee shop tucked between towers of old stone and humming engines, four figures sat in silence.

Elandra sipped slowly from her cup, her gaze locked on the man seated across from her. Her mother, Isabella, rested one hand gently on the table, the other clasped around her own mug. Beside her sat the Warden, still in light armor, alert but calm.

Nocitis sat with them, the years carved into his face like etchings on weathered stone. He didn’t smile. He didn’t speak. He simply was—present, at last.

Steam swirled between them like drifting memories. The tension remained unspoken, thick in the air—but there was no anger. Only time. Lost, reclaimed, and unfolding.

Questions passed without words. Answers hovered between glances. The broken pieces of a family, seated at a table, breathing the same quiet moment together.

Outside, the city pulsed. Inside, they waited—letting the silence stitch something fragile back together.

Epilogue: Nocitis’ Last Moment

Before speaking a word, Nocitis placed three books on the table—each worn by years and burdened with purpose. The first, bound in pale vellum, held the key to saving him. He entrusted it to his daughter, knowing she would one day pass it to the one who needed it most. The second, marked with a darkened spine, contained the truth of what and how to kill him; he set it aside for his cousin and the rightful bearer of that knowledge. The third, wrapped in old cloth, held the story of his own bloodline—his father, his sister, and his mother—all tied to the Titanfallen Isles, the place where light and shadow first shaped his lineage. This one he gave to his sister, the Warden, with a steady hand.

As the weight of his choices settled, exhaustion crept in. His vision blurred. His breath shortened. When he rose from his seat, a thin line of blood slipped from his nose, staining the floor. The room tilted, the world dimmed, and before anyone could reach him, Nocitis collapsed. she also hates tano in genreal 

"
voice_style: Soft and Calm with a Hidden Edge, Measured and Thoughtful
main_personality: She is a curious and imaginative individual who thrives on discovery and transformation. With a mind attuned to both the mysteries of the world and the magic within it, she explores new ideas, forgotten ruins, and untold truths. She is introspective yet bold, driven by a desire to reshape what is broken and uncover what is hidden. Although she never knew her father, she holds a quiet longing to discover his identity—believing the answers may be found in the forgotten corners of the world she’s drawn to.
detailed_personality: Restless Curiosity and Inner Void: Elandra constantly seeks answers—especially about her father, Nocitis. Her desire to understand why he disappeared shapes many of her decisions. This yearning creates a quiet emotional ache beneath her composed exterior. She’s inquisitive, deeply reflective, and always asking questions that others are afraid to ask, particularly about family, legacy, and loss.

Calm, Yet Fierce When Cornered:While she speaks softly and listens more than she talks, Elandra inherited her mother’s sharp intuition and her father’s blade-ready instincts. She’s not easily rattled, but when pushed emotionally or threatened physically, she reacts with unexpected strength—almost as if she’s channeling someone else’s fire. Her calmness is a mask that hides an intense spirit of survival and conviction.

Wounded Seeker of Closure: Elandra carries a deep emotional conflict between acceptance and persistence. Trained in magic by her mother and gifted with her father’s charm and swordsmanship, she possesses a natural talent for both diplomacy and dueling. Yet beneath her composed exterior is a girl who grew up wondering why she was never enough for her father to return.  She masks her pain behind curiosity, exploring not just the world but the cracks in her own story. This quiet obsession drives her to uncover truths others might leave buried. Her emotional patterns lean toward delayed reactions—she processes deeply but often alone. She internalizes guilt that doesn’t belong to her and has a habit of assuming emotional responsibility for the silence others left behind.

apperance:
She has a soft, elegant look with a calm but observant presence. Her long, black hair is tied into a high ponytail, with layered bangs that frame her face, giving her a gentle, almost mysterious expression. Her eyes are a warm, muted rose-brown with a slight downward tilt, making her gaze appear soft and thoughtful. Her dhampir heritage shows in her delicate, pointed ears and the faint sharpness of her small fangs when she speaks.
She wears a flowing ivory blouse with layered ruffles and silver buttons, giving her a refined, almost aristocratic silhouette. Over it, she sometimes wears a deep blue coat with a high collar and broad shoulders—tailored, formal, and clearly hand-made with care. Her posture is composed and polite, but there's a quiet confidence in the way she carries herself, as if she's more capable than she ever shows at first glance.
notable_details: Large almond-shaped eyes—warm brown with a subtle reddish tint, giving her a gentle but sharp gaze
Subtle fangs that show when she speaks or smiles.
Light, natural blush on her cheeks, enhancing her youthful look.
current_occupation: Freelance thief and informant — skilled in deception, infiltration, and gathering secrets. She sells stolen intel to the highest bidder and uses charm as often as stealth.
Fashion designer — creates custom outfits for nobles, spies, and rogues alike. Her designs blend flair with function, often hiding blades, lockpicks, or poisons within elegant fabric
Baker & Cook – Owns or works in a small bakery by day, crafting pastries, meals, and comforting sweets. Cooking is her way of coping and showing care—especially through chocolate.
Student – Actively studies arcane theory, stealth techniques, or cultural studies
previous_occupation: Apprentice Seamstress – She started learning the art of tailoring and fabric work from a young age.
Pastry Assistant – Helped in a family-owned bakery or local café, where she honed her love for sweets.
hobbies: Cooking sweets – Especially experimenting with chocolate recipes.
Star‑gazing – Quiet nights spent under the sky bring her peace.
Flirt‑and‑steal “dates” – She casually dates people to charm information out of them… and sometimes walks away with their gold.
signature_object: A worn leather-bound journal containing cryptic drawings and coded entries. It belonged to her father, who used it to hide dangerous secrets and forbidden knowledge. She never lets it out of her sight, believing it holds clues about his past.
An old silver locket with a faded picture inside—on one side, her family; on the other, a blank silhouette that shifts shape when moonlight touches it. It’s a sentimental item.
signature_weapon: “Requiem’s Kiss” – A slender, obsidian-forged rapier with silver filigree wrapping its blade like dying vines. Its guard is shaped like a weeping rose, and the hilt hums faintly with sorrowful energy.
“Ring of Soft Lies”-A silver ring shaped like a coiling serpent biting its own tail.
“Velvet Requiem”-A collapsible wrist-mounted crossbow disguised as a bracelet.

"Father’s Silence"-A plain, worn dagger tucked away in her boot—easily overlooked by most.  Appearance: Dull steel blade with a cracked ivory handle. No markings remain… except for a faint symbol only her father would recognize.

name: asda123
backstory:
"

Chapter 1: Petals in the Sacred Dance

In a peaceful town on the outskirts of Hemlock in the country of Mondral a young girl in the name of Lute Celestara grew up in a church. Without proper parents and no sign of who their parents are. She was raised to be a church girl who was an awfully kind and peaceful soul.
She had always taken reading seriously, despite being in a church which follows Lord death, she takes it upon herself to learn about each and every god, demi-god to her best capabilities.
Within a small field that once was barren with dead grass and lifeless trees a Priestess had watched Lute tend to the barren land. Within a few months when the priestess decided to check on the barren land. She came across Lute dancing and singing with a field filled with flowers and fluorescent grass that glistens in the sunlight.

Chapter 2: Reverence in Motion

Within the church, during one of the times of prayer, Lute has grown to be a sort of idol amongst not just the church but to the locals as this singer who isn't quite a priestess but also a wonderful singer whom people actually began to adore and showed up for church despite them only being there for the performances.

Most of the Priests and Priestess’s did not like that the Church is being less used as a church and more like a stage. Whispers had long grown among the clergy that the faithful came for her voice more than the sermons.
They had planned something to poison Lute with her own flowers with some being poisonous, though during the scandal Lute had found out about it by overhearing.

Quietly within the night she prayed to Lord Death for forgiveness that she’s leaving the church and to set out. Once packing her belongings along with her hand-crafted Lute that she made using one of the dead trees she used to make the beautiful garden, she sets out. Giving out a small Prayer to both Tryarha Mithso for good luck and Limia to help guide her throughout the night on her long walks.


Chapter 3: Petalwaltz

Throughout her travels, she had come across the Intelegentsia guild, she was naturally talented with learning information. She in fact was Alarmingly talented with how magic works along with how the intricacies of how the weave works. Though was often side-tracked with her passion of creating music and poetry with constant prayers to different gods with various tasks she does.

They however found uses for her, she can be used to travel and give Letters if magic was not an option. Though during one of the travels Lute found that there was one odd letter that she had rehearsed to remember as she always speaks the letter and burns it so nobody but her knows about what the letter said. It however left her disturbed with the Intelegentsia guild, she left in the middle of her mission from the guild as it went against her beliefs baring to knowledge of the letter. With this being the first letter that felt like a sin to speak aloud.

After she had left she pursued music where she found major success amongst the crowd even among dark times, she was a beacon that people looked to for happiness with her kind smile and positive outlook.

Though with the kindness of one's dance, there must be a contrasting force to even the brightest beacons right at their doorstep.

Chapter 4: One Who Walks a Half-Step Behind—and Asks Me to Dance

During her trip to Orange Coral which was meant to be a show for many people to come and see. Within the show it had been going wonderfully, throughout the night sky there were lights going on with wondrous color. Though she had noticed there being more guards out than normal. Perhaps for her own protection, Security had been tightened after recent stalking attempts considering the popularity is the assumption she went under.
Though during her time on stage, tragedy struck with portals opening in the sky and monsters rained down. During the chaos that unfolded she prayed to Barkakit to try and figure out what was going on. But before she could finish the prayer her shoulder was grabbed with a lady named Ina telling her to move it and to get out of here. Lute seeing the people panicked and her wishing to help refused, with a determined look told her that “I won’t leave them behind”

Ina seeing the look on Lute and not having the luxury of time folded as she said to help get as many civilians out. With the both working together managed to do so. Both talking along the way of their brief introductions, Ina was part of the crowds that she saw for her show. At one point they had to part ways with promises of potentially seeing each other again sometime, Lute leaving saw the chaos of what had happened, and vows to help as many individuals as she can without killing and redeem as many people as possible.

Chapter 5: Scattered Petals

In her sleep a memory is formed, though she cannot dream she felt like she had seen this before..she cannot see within whatever realm she's in, Feelings of flowers are on her eyes and her face, neck, even arms. She can feel like she is being held by something, either warm or cold with a voice speaking to her in sadness as she lays there weak. Without her knowledge she began speaking. “______…wont..you..smile…For me?”...sniffling can be heard from the male “Lute…I..” Her mouth would begin moving on her own again saying “Please…Wont..Last….Long”

The male would compose themselves slowly as tears drip onto her face “yeah.. I’m smiling Sweetheart…Im..Smiling”. Lute could feel her mouth open, muttering words that even she cannot understand. “Hm..? Can you…Say that again..I didnt…Quite catch that…”

…

"

backstory:
"

Chapter I: A Child Born Under a Waning Moon

In a quiet corner of the realm, far from kingdoms and courts, the shadow of Lord Draken still lingered long after his fall. Though centuries had passed, people whispered that his blood had not gone silent—that one day, a descendant would emerge carrying both his face and his curse.
It was there that Noctis Shadowbrook was born.
From the moment he opened his eyes, it was clear he carried something ancient within him. His reflection seemed older than his years, and the aura surrounding him unsettled even those with steady hearts. Elders often paused as they looked at him, murmuring that some legacies refused to fade.
Sometimes, when Noctis passed a still pond at twilight, he imagined the surface rippled not from wind, but from a memory not his own. “Maybe his magic is still watching,” he wondered. “Maybe it never left.”

Chapter II: The Echo of His Father’s Magic

Noctis grew quietly, but not peacefully.

As he aged, strange visions began to surface—
shards of battles he had never fought,
victories he had never earned,
and emotions far too heavy for someone so young.

These were not dreams.
They were fragments of Lord Draken’s final spell.

Before his defeat, the tyrant had woven an enchantment meant to bind pieces of his soul, memories, and hunger into the blood of his last descendant. It was not a curse meant to destroy Noctis—

It was a curse meant to shape him.

When night fell, shadows sometimes stirred on their own. When the air grew still, he felt a cold presence settle over his shoulders. And whenever fear or anger surfaced, he sensed the remnants of Draken’s will testing him—pushing him.

Most would fear such a burden.
Noctis chose to understand it instead.

Chapter III: The Crescent Veil

As the inherited magic within him deepened, Noctis's life changed the moment The Crescent Veil  was created 

Founded by Nocitis, the Crescent Veil was a hidden order dedicated to protecting dhampirs and all beings misunderstood or hunted by the world. Its symbol—a crescent moon wrapped in shifting mist—represented the duality of their heritage and the secrecy required to survive it.

To Noctis, the Crescent Veil offered something rare:
Not fear, not suspicion, but purpose.

Their Beliefs

• Every soul deserves the chance to find its place in the world.
• Knowledge is not a luxury—it is survival.
• Unity and secrecy are the shield against a world that fears what it does not understand.

Their Work

They operated from hidden sanctuaries called Safe Havens, each one protected by wards older than most kingdoms.
They guarded libraries of forgotten lore, gathering ancient scrolls and texts on dhampir magic and culture.
They maintained the Shadow Network, a vast web of informants that warned them of threats long before danger arrived.

Their Structure

• Moonlit Sovereign — Valerian, the founder and guiding hand of the Veil.
• Veil Wardens — commanders who protected specific regions.
• Mist Seekers — scouts and spies who sought those needing refuge.
• Lunar Acolytes — scholars dedicated to preserving dhampir history.
• Eclipsed Guardians — warriors and mages who defended their people.

Their hidden headquarters, the Moon Shadow Sanctum, lay deep beneath a quiet inn, shielded by illusions and winding tunnels.

Within these halls, Noctis finally learned the truth of his heritage—not through fear, but through understanding.

The elders taught him that his father's magic did not define him.
His choices did.

Slowly, he began to see the difference between inheritance and destiny.

Chapter IV: The Path He Walks

With the Veil's guidance, Noctis confronted the memories haunting him. He sifted through Lord Draken's triumphs and cruelties, understanding their weight but refusing to repeat them.

The world outside still murmured about Draken's potential return, and hunters roamed the lands seeking to end any remnant of his bloodline. But Noctis did not run.

He stepped forward instead.

He protected those who could not defend themselves.
He shielded the Crescent Veil's safe havens from those who wished their destruction.
And each night, as the crescent moon rose, he reminded himself:

“I carry his shadow… but it does not carry me.”

In time, the members of the Crescent Veil gave him a title—
not one born of fear, but of respect:

The Daywalker 

A reminder that even the darkest legacy can be shaped into something that guards the world, rather than threatens it.

apperance:
He is a tall, elegant figure with a sharp, refined presence. His posture is confident but controlled, giving him the air of a noble swordsman. He has long black hair, tied loosely at the back, with a few strands falling across his face. His eyes are a striking icy blue, calm yet piercing, framed by pointed elven ears.

He wears a layered outfit of deep blues and grays, combining noble fashion with practical armor pieces. A flowing midnight-blue cape drapes over his shoulders, giving him a regal silhouette. His attire includes a high-collared shirt with ornate embroidery, a fitted vest, and reinforced sleeves protected by light armor.

His sword glows with a faint blue light, carried naturally at his side as though it belongs to him. Everything about him—from his clean, composed movements to the controlled grip on his weapon—reflects discipline, precision, and quiet authority.

hobbies: He likes quiet moonlit walks and high places where he can think clearly.
Quiet Reading and Studying Old Texts  He prefers peaceful moments with history, strategy, or arcane lore.
Polishing and maintaining his sword is a calming ritual that keeps him focused.
He enjoys wandering through new places and witnessing the world's ever-changing landscape.
He keeps strange little souvenirs from his travels, insisting every odd item—no matter how useless—holds “deep sentimental value.”
He writes heartfelt letters late at night but never sends them, tucking them away unread.
signature_object: A slim silver band engraved with her initials. It warms faintly whenever she’s near.
A soft ribbon tied around his wrist or kept in his coat pocket, carrying her scent and calming his mind.
signature_weapon: “The Starshard Pendant” A blue crystal around his neck that channels his magic and steadies his mind.
“Lunarvein” A slender longsword with a blue core that glows brighter when his dhampir senses awaken.
notable_accomplishments: Fighting a eldritch monster
Getting married, despite not understanding the concept of a wedding.
The character has three children: two are from a relationship with Isabella, and one is from a relationship with Kiki.

affiliations.name: The Gloam Covenant
affiliations.notes:
The Gloam Covenant

Founder: Nocitis Shadowbrook
Allegiance: None (independent)
Reputation: Necessary evil, silent arbitrators, shadow-dealers
Moral Alignment: Deliberately gray
“Justice is a luxury. Survival is a duty.” — Covenant creed

Purpose & Philosophy

The Gloam Covenant was not formed to protect a race. It was formed to control outcomes. Where the Crescent Veil believes in refuge, unity, and preservation, the Gloam Covenant believes in intervention, manipulation, and prevention at any cost. They act before threats become wars—often in ways no one will ever praise. They do not ask who deserves saving. They ask what must be done.

Why It Exists (and Why It Hates Her)

Half of the Covenant’s members were once part of the Crescent Veil. They left for one reason: They believe Noctis’s sister is a liability. Some see her as too idealistic. Others see her as dangerous, reckless, or destined to fracture the Veil from within. A few believe her presence will eventually expose the Veil to annihilation. Nocitis does not openly share their hatred—but he does not stop them either. The Covenant exists because he knows the world will not be saved by purity alone.

Membership

The Gloam Covenant is not race-bound. Humans, elves, dhampirs, tieflings, shadar-kai, and others serve side by side. Loyalty is earned through action, not blood.

Internal Divide

The Veilborn — former Crescent Veil agents who abandoned its ideals
The Unbound — outsiders drawn to the Covenant’s ruthless clarity

This divide is tense but functional.

Structure

The Arbiter — Nocitis Shadowbrook
Silent authority. Final word. Rarely overrules—more often watches.

Black Keys
Strategists and planners. They decide who must be removed, bribed, or broken.

Gloam Hands
Operatives. Assassins, saboteurs, interrogators, retrieval agents.

Ledger Keepers
Archivists who record debts, secrets, favors, and sins. Nothing is erased—only delayed.

Methods

Assassination (clean or cruel, as needed)
Memory alteration or erasure
Political manipulation
Forced disappearances
False flag operations
Blackmail through truth—not lies

They do not protect innocents directly. They remove what threatens them.

"

  • Dox is a changeling that was cursed and tormented by an archfey in the feywilds corrupting their blood and mind, who upon escaping it to reach vallarian tried their best to adapt to society, who adopted many personalities in order to fit in each leaving permanent effects on his mental health. One of these personalities created by the archfey themselves often leads to dark thoughts that dox perceives is from Barkakit which when it either takes or is given control gives Dox a near uncontrollable will for chaos, whether this be petty crime or a strange bloodlust. One of these events led to a well known hero (who is the son of a famous general during the war) in the continent (name pending depending if you want to name them for story or me) hunting Dox down. Dox doesn’t remember what exactly happened when confronted by the hero, all they know is that they “woke up” next to their corpse covered in the hero's blood and when they saw a reflection of themselves saw that they had morphed into the hero's form and donned the mask. Shortly after he was confronted by a kenku who was accompanying the hero who witnessed the event, decided to take advantage of the situation threatening to report him unless he helped him make money.


  •  This new life came with unexpected positives for Dox, as he continuously met those who “they” had protected and saved the hero's personality started to take hold as it gave Dox a true sense of belonging giving him a drive to try to help protect and rid the world of evil. However despite doing the “right” thing, they often leave the scene much more bloody and gruesome than what a “hero” should while fighting as if possessed as the true Dox still comes to the surface.

apperance:
Her skin is pale with an almost translucent sheen, as if it barely conceals the pulse of life beneath. Her hair cascades in uneven layers of white that bleed into deep magenta at the tips, the colours shifting subtly in different light, as though caught between mortal and fey realms.

Her eyes are large and glassy, an uncanny shade of pink that borders on luminescent, framed by dark circles that make them seem even wider. They hold a strange mix of innocence and hunger — the gaze of someone who sees more than she should. Her lips are faintly tinted with the same pink hue as her hair, giving her an otherworldly vibrancy against her pale complexion.

Delicate pointed ears peek through her hair, betraying her changeling nature. A dark, high-collared strap wraps around her neck, contrasting sharply with her light skin — both practical restraint and statement. Her build is slender and deceptively frail, yet every movement carries a coiled precision, like a predator testing its patience.

name: Frank Columbo
backstory:
"

Chapter 1

The Matsugane Alliance and Family 


In the basement of Visiakarta Trading, the headquarters for the Matsugane Alliance located in Istegra. Mafuyu Matsugane watches 16 eggs she incubated begin to hatch, as she is the black dragon who laid them months prior. Out of the 16 Koldbolds that hatched, only one resembled Mafuyu's dragon form. That Kolbold will take the name of her late husband, Takayuki Matsugane, and will serve her every desire.

Mafuyu Matsugane (aka Mother) is the current Patriarch of the Matsugane Family and the 4th chairman of the Matsugane Alliance, a yakuza style criminal organization. The Matsugane Alliance is a gang organization that expands the majority of Istegra and is controlled by five families with the Matsugane Family being the largest. The Matsugane is located in the city of Visiakarta, and smuggles weapons, drugs, and people in and out of Prosporo. People would hire the Matsugane Family to protect precious cargo that was required to make it to it's Intended location. Their capabilities exceeded any other protection and had the willingness to go anywhere in Vallah.


Chapter 2

The Advisor of Mafuyu Matsugane, Takayuki Matsugane(Frank Columbo), his mentor, Osamu Kashiwagi, and a friend, Iris Tchaikovsky 


Frank being a pure black scaled Kobold means he resembled Mafuyu's dragon form the most due to having her sacred bloodline. He was given a life of luxury by Mafuyu and at the age of 6, he began learning the duties of being an Advisor of Mafuyu. This role was given to the most important person to Mafuyu and would work closely with her.

           The person tasked with training Frank was a Shadow Elf named Osamu Kashiwagi. Kashiwagi was the captain of the Matsugane Family and had an extensive background in fighting techniques he gathered throughout the ages. He not only taught Frank how to fight, but also taught him his role as an advisor. Frank was taught various traditions and etiquette of the Yakuza.

 As an advisor for Mafuyu, Frank would attend any and all meetings between families and with business partners. Frank also acted as an emotional arm for Mafuyu, a place for her to vent and have Frank try to care for her emotionally and act on her desires and fantasies.

While being close to Mafuyu, Frank got to know one of her servants, a 20 year old Amethyst dragonborn named Iris Tchaikovsky. Iris was this shy maid who was to specifically serve Frank. She began to open up to Frank and she was looking for funding for an expedition for ancient songs owned by her ancestors. But instead, Mufuyu made her a slave.

\t


Chapter 3

The splintering of Frank from the Matsugane Family and the meeting of Emi.

2 years passed and Frank noticed that Iris was absent one day and confronted Mafuyu about where she was. Mafuyu wasn’t so fond of the attention Frank was giving her so she had her disposed of in the dungeon so Frank could put all his attention to her and order him to her room. Frank ignored this and rushed to the dungeon and rescued this beaten and battered Dragonborn. There were many issues trying to get her out and Frank had to fight his way through groups of people preventing their escape.      

          Frank brought Iris to a chapel of the goddess Talia since the Matsugane Family won't touch holy sites. Approaching the priestess, Frank noticed a Sapphire Dragonborn in the temple who approached him, thanking him for making her job easier. She introduces herself as Emi and she was hired to find Iris and bring her back to Maple.

Frank asked if he could help, wanting to move on from here since going back would not be smart. Emi agreed and the three of them waited until dawn. At dawn, the streets were flooded with Matsugane Family thugs looking for Frank and Iris. The three make their way out of Visiakarta and make their way to maple.

After Frank's assault through the Matsugane HQ, the event became known as when one of Mafuyu’s boys went mad giving Frank the nickname, “The Mad Dog of Mafuyu”. 



Chapter 4

A New Start at the Little Dragon’s Detective Agency


The three made it back to maple and when they arrived at the family estate of Tchaikovsky, Iris pleaded to not meet her parents again, wanting to live with Emi and Frank, because her parents were too strict. Emi was two kind hearted and allowed Iris to visit anytime she wanted to.

Arriving at the agency, it was more like a house with a small segment with a professional look to it where you would talk to clients. The house has 4 bedrooms, so Frank has his own room. Frank felt obligated to try and help civilians, taking small and unassuming jobs to build rapport with the locals. He even took down scammers and fraudsters since they were a nuisance to the public. 



Chapter 5

Marriage to Emi and a unforgettable pregnancy. 


          Frank spent three years with Emi. Spending all this time together, even having Emi help reject his pass and change his name to Frank Columbo. Frank was having a hard time transitioning to civilian life after 25 years with the Yakuza. In this time and Emi was also a victim of crappy parents too, the two eventually became very close and began dating. Frank would scrounge up funds to try and go do fun and interesting things with Emi which Emi absolutely adored. Before all this, Iris confessed her love to Frank, but Frank rejected her as he didn't reciprocate these feelings 

            After being together in this way for a little over a year and a half, Frank decided to save some money, buy a wedding ring for Emi and it had this bright Sapphire gem on it and proposed to her. She was ecstatic and said yes! Emi went out to pick a ring for Frank and she got those diamond crusted band. For him

          Months later, Emi discovered she might be pregnant and was again ecstatic but also a bit worried. At the same time, Frank got offered a job that can provide enough money for them to live comfortably and focus on taking care of the child. Frank grabs the wrong bag and heads to the meeting point. 

(Beginning of CwL)

Mafuyu Matsugane (Mother/Leader) old

Osamu Kashiwagi (Mentor) 100 something 

Emi Zuri (Columbo later/Wife) 33

Iris Tchaikovsky () 25

name: Eugen
skin_colour: Light fair complexion, suited to a northern, colder region
hair: Black, slightly tousled, medium-length, with natural waves
backstory:
"

Chapter I — Bloodline of the Guardian Keep

Eugen Beniko was born into a lineage bound by oath and shadow. For generations, the Beniko family served as guardians of a mysterious relic, its purpose long obscured by time yet protected with absolute devotion.
Raised in the cold halls of Beniko Keep, high in the northern mountains, Eugen’s childhood was shaped by rigorous training, ancient expectations, and stories of honor passed from one generation to the next.
Even then, there was something different about him—a quiet depth, a gaze that lingered on things unseen, as if he sensed a world beneath the world.

Chapter II — Awakening to the Weave

While his kin devoted themselves to perfecting martial skill, Eugen felt drawn toward something greater: the Weave, the invisible tapestry of arcane energy that underlies all creation.
In hidden chambers beneath the keep, he meditated with the ancestral sword placed before him. Over time, he learned to hear the faint, living hum of the Weave threading through the stones, the air, and his own pulse.
Through focus and stillness, he discovered that the Weave did not merely surround him—it responded to him. It sharpened his senses, strengthened his body, and allowed arcane energy to flow through him as naturally as breath.
This bond grew stronger with each passing year, culminating in a rare talent few warriors ever touched: telekinetic control. Objects shifted at the edge of his perception. Attacks slowed when aimed at him. The battlefield itself bent subtly under the pressure of his will.

No Beniko knight had ever displayed such affinity for the Weave.
No record suggested such a gift was possible.
The Weave had chosen him, and him alone.

Chapter III — Eugen and the Weave

Eugen’s connection to the Weave defied explanation even among the elders. They could sense magic only faintly—yet he interacted with it as effortlessly as drawing breath.
There was no ritual, no technique, no ancient doctrine guiding him. What he accomplished was not something taught; it was something awakened.
He touched the Weave instinctively, gently, as though it were an extension of his own mind. Through this bond, he learned to steady falling objects, redirect incoming blows, and influence the world with subtle shifts of arcane force.

The elders soon realized a truth they kept unspoken:
no one in House Beniko could replicate what Eugen did.
Whatever destiny the Weave hinted at, it belonged solely to him.

Chapter IV — The Relic of Unknown Origin

Central to the Beniko oath was a relic: a mysterious hilt, immaculate despite its age. Crafted of mithral, enchanted obsidian, elegant gold tracery, and an adamantine grip, the object radiated faint but undeniable arcane presence.
To others, the relic remained silent and cold.
But whenever Eugen neared it, the Weave stirred—subtle ripples, like a breath being held.
The hilt did nothing, yet somehow it noticed him.
Its nature remained hidden, its purpose lost in the fog of forgotten centuries, but Eugen sensed that the Weave and the relic were entwined. And he suspected that the answers lay not within the keep, but beyond its walls.

Chapter V — The Call Beyond the Mountains

When he came of age, restlessness pushed against Eugen’s heart. The elders’ silence regarding the relic’s origin only strengthened his resolve. The Weave whispered of a road untraveled, a truth waiting beyond the northern cliffs.
He donned his armor, took up the Beniko sword, and secured the relic-hilt at his side.
With a final bow to his family, he descended the mountain path.
Not as a knight fulfilling duty—but as a seeker compelled by something greater than heritage or tradition.

Chapter VI — Trials of the Wandering Knight

Eugen’s journey took him across kingdoms and wildlands, where civilization dissolved into ancient mysteries. He ventured through enchanted forests, studied forgotten ruins, and crossed blades with foes drawn to the relic’s quiet aura.
In every trial, his bond with the Weave deepened.
He learned to blend swordsmanship with arcane force, shaping the Weave into precise bursts of power, guiding blades with invisible currents, and defending himself through instinctive telekinetic interference.
Scholars saw him and faltered. Mages sensed him and grew wary. Some sought to mentor him; others tried to claim the relic.
But none understood what he carried—not truly.

Chapter VII — The Hilt, the Legacy, the Destiny

Through all his travels, the relic-hilt remained pristine, untouched by time, bound by potential yet unrealized.
Eugen felt it growing more attuned to him with each new awakening of the Weave. There were nights when the hilt felt almost warm—nights when the Weave pulsed faintly around it, as if preparing for something long delayed.
He came to understand:
His family had not guarded a mere artifact.
They had guarded a destiny—one that had waited generations to find him.
Whatever the relic truly was—weapon, key, or conduit—it would reveal itself in time.
And when it did, the Weave would guide him.

"
detailed_personality: Eugen is a calm, introspective knight whose sense of justice comes not from law or tradition, but from a deeply personal moral compass shaped by compassion and an unshakable desire to protect others.

fear_weakness.from: His stoic nature makes it difficult for him to open up or ask for help. He carries pain quietly, often isolating himself rather than showing vulnerability

motivation.how: He travels tirelessly, studies forgotten lore, and tests the limits of his abilities because he believes answering the relic’s mystery will determine not only his fate but the fate of his family’s ancient oath.
motivation.from: Growing up surrounded by secrecy, ritual, and unanswered questions, Eugen’s life purpose naturally formed around pursuing truth.
motivation.motivation: To understand the relic and the Weave’s purpose for him.

Eugen is a striking young man with sharp, watchful eyes that seem to read the world quietly. His dark hair falls in unruly waves, creating a contrast against his pale skin and giving him a brooding but noble air.

He wears a heavy black fur-lined cloak for warmth, layered over finely crafted noble attire adorned with intricate threadwork and sigils of House Beniko. His gloves and belts are practical and worn from long travel.
His posture is refined yet relaxed — the stance of someone trained from birth for combat but softened by humility. At his hip rests his ancestral blade, while the mysterious relic-hilt remains secured close to his body, wrapped in dark cloth and leather bindings. Subtle ripples of the Weave linger around him, barely noticeable unless one knows how to look.

Silent meditation to attune to the Weave.

name: Ziost
backstory:
"

Introduction


Ziost Aslan born into the illustrious Aslan Arsenal, founded by a well-known Leonin family of House Aslan for crafting specialized arms—ranging from enchanted firearms and melee weapons to devastating prototype siege engines and also has some factories for consumer goods (Hoi4 Reference). The Aslan’s innovations have benefited the economy of Mondral, and the Armed Forces of the Mondralian Army. Ziost, the supposed heir of the Aslan Arsenal, trained not only in the art of fighting, but also in the art of forge creation.

Takeover


However, The Yunaka Foundation, an organization that controls most of Mondral’s economy, still had a desire to grow by absorbing other organizations to expand its power. When they sought the Aslan Arsenal under their control, Their method? A hostile takeover—by blood. One fateful night, under the shroud of a crimson moon, the Foundation’s enforcers stormed the Aslan estate. Ziost fought desperately alongside his family, but they were outnumbered and outmatched. He watched, helpless, as his kin were slaughtered, his home burned, and his legacy that he was to inherit -stolen.

Coincidence or Fate

Bleeding out among the ruins of his lineage, Ziost felt the weight of finality—his story was ending before it had truly begun. But in that moment of despair, the world seemed to freeze. Time itself stilled. A voice, ancient yet melodic, echoed through the void:
"You do not wish to die. And I do not wish to see your time undone."
Before him stood Talia, Guardian of the Flow of Time, an ethereal entity draped in silken veils that shimmered with cascading stars. Perhaps Ziost had called out to her in his desperation—or perhaps she had already foreseen his plight and reached out first.
I will restore you, Ziost of the Aslan House. But know this—time does not give freely. It demands purpose."
She rewove the strands of his fate, pulling him from the precipice of death. Yet, in exchange, Ziost was bound to Talia’s Bidding. His body healed, but the scars of that night were more than physical. Now a warlock, his power ebbed and flowed like the tides of history—sometimes allowing him glimpses of what was, other times nudging events toward what could be albeit only a possibility.
Now armed with the powers of his patron Talia, lives his life how he can while following Talia’s words

name: Elyra
backstory:
"

Chapter I : Early Life & Takao

In the quiet valley of Takao of the Country Delstanvia. Among its hills stood a small cloth and clothes shop, owned by two kind souls Astaria Edenria (Father) and Liebhaberin Endenria (Mother) from the distant land of Mondral.

Their daughter, Elyra Edenria, grew up among threads and laughter. Hands always dusted with dye, hair smelling faintly of lavender and smoke. Her parents taught her the art of weaving, but also its patience. “A good cloth,” her mother would say, “isn’t made by force. It listens. It waits.” Elyra believed her mother was talking about more than fabric.


Sometimes, as she worked the loom, she’d pause to watch how a single misplaced thread could change the whole pattern. “Maybe people are like that too,” she thought. “Each one changes the world, even just a little.”


Chapter II : The Pathstrider of Talia

The Edenria family kept a small shrine above their hearth. A polished silver mirror, framed with brass. It was a humble altar to Talia, the Weaver, the goddess who bound past, present, and future through her eternal loom.

“If every life is a thread,” she often wondered, “then maybe Talia doesn’t just weave us forward and protect us. maybe She listens to us, too.... Although she is the Silent Goddess, hard for me to tell haha” Which she laugh nervously to.

On still evenings whenever she is alone, the candle burned low, Elyra sometimes thought she saw her reflection blink a moment too late, or smile just before she did. It frightened her once. Then it comforted her now. She doesn't know why it does, but it makes her fell safe.


Chapter III : The Plagues Which Pull Her Threads

The peace of Takao rarely changed, which is until several travelers from the East came. They spoke of a strange magical plague spreading through Delstanvia’s borderlands: spells failing, reflections moving on their own, and people losing whole days of memory as if time itself had skipped.

Most in the village dismissed it as distant rumor as there are only a couple of folks who bestow this tale. But when Elyra prayed that night, the flame before Talia’s mirror bent sideways, and for an instant, she saw the reflection of her own hands, unraveling into light. “Something is off... This is not just a simple rumor... This is something else,” she whispered.


No voice answered her, but she felt it. A gentle pull, like the tug of a thread asking to be followed. That quiet, patient feeling she’d always known at the loom was now inside her, urging her to move.


Chapter IV : The Reason She Walks

Elyra left Takao at dawn. The sky was pale and the river mist low. She carried only what she could: a travel cloak, her prayer mirror wrapped in cloth, a spool of blue silk tied around her wrist, and her mother’s quiet blessing. “If the world is fraying,” Liebhaberin told her, “then mend it where you can, my love. Even a single stitch can save a pattern.”


Her father, Astaria, pressed a hand to her shoulder. “Please stay safe...” he said softly although trying to act tough as he doesn't want to show weakness towards his own daughter in this uncertain time, but he knew there is high chance she might get hurt if she head East.


She then walk forward towards the direction East heading towards a meeting place where she may meet with someone who have been searching for Adventurer to help out the situation of the Magical Plague which many dismiss, but she wish to give it a try.

Most in the village dismissed it as distant rumor as there are only a couple of folks who bestow this tale. But when Elyra prayed that night, the flame before Talia’s mirror bent sideways, and for an instant, she saw the reflection of her own hands, unraveling into light. “Something is off... This is not just a simple rumor... This is something else,” she whispered.


No voice answered her, but she felt it. A gentle pull, like the tug of a thread asking to be followed. That quiet, patient feeling she’d always known at the loom was now inside her, urging her to move.


Chapter V : The Reason She Walks

Elyra left Takao at dawn. The sky was pale and the river mist low. She carried only what she could: a travel cloak, her prayer mirror wrapped in cloth, a spool of blue silk tied around her wrist, and her mother’s quiet blessing. “If the world is fraying,” Liebhaberin told her, “then mend it where you can, my love. Even a single stitch can save a pattern.”


Her father, Astaria, pressed a hand to her shoulder. “Please stay safe...” he said softly although trying to act tough as he doesn't want to show weakness towards his own daughter in this uncertain time, but he knew there is high chance she might get hurt if she head East.


She then walk forward towards the direction East heading towards a meeting place where she may meet with someone who have been searching for Adventurer to help out the situation of the Magical Plague which many dismiss, but she wish to give it a try.
