name: Celeste
backstory:
"

Prologue : Dusk of an age brings Dawn to another.
The Reznova family was one pushed to great lengths out of desperation. Celeste A girl who in another life, would've been raised as nobility. Yet had that door closed to her as her family threw that away all for a chance to fight against fate, one of misfortune seemingly destined to bring and end to her family. Years of treachery anguish and misfortune would fall upon her family, yet no matter how far they seeked how hard they tried not even the gods would give them answers.

Yet all that would change when Victorio her father, would be called out to by a hag where he would be told that to bring an end to this fate they'd have to \"Destroy the corruption\", and that their Daughter would bring justice to their family. Understanding how it would look, her parents walked away from their once prestigious lives to not be seen as tyrants hungry for power, though to them believed this would be a small price to pay for their daughter to be free.

Chapter 1 :

Celeste grew up not having contact with anyone her age as she was raised in an outpost of (Guild, Faction, Group whatever is more fitting to the DM's discretion but I will be referring to as Guild.) Her father Victorio was the Spymaster of the Guild he would often be out undercover or infiltrating the ranks and members of groups and organizations that the guild or himself would have interest in. Leaving Celeste in the care of a woman who in reality was Celeste's mother, or later on as she got older she'd spend her time with Javier a blacksmith at the guild who'd end up being the last remaining person Victorio could trust.

Though her family would have hoped for Celeste to have been able to have a normal life, the environment she grew up in nor her father's secrecy helped that situation. Celeste would go by the nicknames that people in the guild would call her, though thankfully enough it seemed like everyone around her was kind to her. Often spending time listening to the stories from people who've stopped by at the outpost or joining them in little hunting expeditions seemingly just to kill time. Though she understands now that it might not have been truly from the kindness of their hearts but more so possibly from fear of angering her father the unnamed spy master. Who due to what he did in his job was given the nickname Death.

Chapter 2: Hopeless faith against the fated

All of this would change when she was around 9 years old when she'd run into one of her own betraying them. Vautrin, one of two people her father trusted and her would run into two fellow guild members. Though to Celeste, never being one who understood why her father went to such length to not hold trust in others hesitated... which would cost Vautrin his life. She's seen them drinking and laughing together so many times, all for it to seemingly mean nothing. She had the opportunity to stop them before they could have hurt her or him, yet hesitation was all it took for them to strike Vautrin down. Though in that, the shock fueled by pure rage and the combat prowess that her father had taught her allowed her to emerge victorious avenging Vautrin. Severely injured nearly losing her right eye, her father would rush back upon hearing the news. Celeste was then taken to see the hag her father once met, where she'd end up getting aid for the eye but couldn't have anything done about her fate. 

When they returned her father fell into a deeper obsession with the whole premise. Never wanting to be a victim of circumstance again and wanting to possibly take action against her own fate, from this point onward Celeste would focus on getting better in combat. Wanting to follow in her father's footsteps so this wouldn't be a burden that he would continue to face on his own. Though it was at this point where her mother started heavily distancing herself from her and her father. With her change in character and motivation, she would finally gain a nickname by those around her that would end up sticking with her; DD, Death's Daughter.

Chapter 3: The Calling

Celeste's father would send letters back home to update his daughter on how he was doing. Though the letter she received from his latest excursion deeply concerning to her, and seemingly an omen of what was to come. The only thing she could make of it was how it seemed to come off as a warning that something was to come, and that it may have some involvement with \"The Mark\" that her father's mentioned for all these years. Putting the thought in her mind that they might finally have found the answer they've been looking for.

Though up to that point nothing as bad as the incident years prior had occurred to her, she still had trauma of her inaction causing the death of someone she cared about. She showed the letter to her mother and Javier and voiced her concerns about wanting to figure out where her father headed. Javier headed to try to get intel on where Victorio's latest query, though the next morning when Celeste woke up she would find that her mother was no where to be seen. As telling as it could've been to make a connection with the warning in the letter, it made as much if not more sense to Celeste that her mother used this as an opportunity to just get away from it all. With Celeste now being completely alone, she swore to herself that she'd find her father.

While waiting for Javier to come back with the information, Celeste decided to spend some time settling her thoughts away from anyone but herself. During this trek she'd came upon a scene where a three headed dragon was being attacked seemingly defending a younger one of their kind. A feeling of connection, unity brought Celeste to come to its aid. When Celeste ran up to help it in the aftermath, there was a sudden flash of bright light, and a burning sensation on her left hand. A mark, one of which she's seen in her fathers scribbles from before, The Mark of power. In front of her where the dragon stood was now a black stone giving off a dull iridescent light. Knowing full well that if her father wasn't able to, she'd have less of a chance figuring out anything behind what just happened. She took it in stride now having a new companion at her side.

Chapter 4:

Javier would later return bearing information about her father's ware bouts. Though concerned about the distinct change in Celeste she brushed it aside. The latest group that her father went out to investigate was the Intelligentsia guild. Though due to the secrecy of said guild information was hard to come by Javier found out that they were planning an expedition. Seeing this as her only chance, Celeste and Javier used their connections to get her a spot on the boat. Though Celeste tried to go under the Facade of just a kid trying to prove herself, trying her best to not possibly compromise herself if someone would know the involvement of her or her father and who they truly were.  

"

name: Janus
backstory:
"

Chapter 1: Early Life


Growing up, Janus felt Loved, Supported and Important. His Parents. Suni Undread and Hector Vivian Undread are his whole world. His mother was his emotional guidance whilst his father was his mental and logical guidance growing up. Both however dearly cared for him and would teach him with a caring hold and grip.

However when his brother Garmal was born, his mother had died whilst conceiving his brother. His worldview shattered. Out of his father and him, Janus took it the worst with not understanding what had happened, but it didn’t discourage him in trying to take the role to help.

Chapter 2: Too Old for Yesterday


At 12 years of age he had already been acting far beyond his age, he had to cope with the loss of his mother and the increasing distance of his father that he’s been putting between himself and Janus and his brother by pretending to be who he isn’t. To preserve what Child in him is left he has always been with his brother, he cares for his brother deeply, Always prioritizing their needs over his own.

One day, his father exited his own room and like a moth to a flame Janus ran to his father for Attention and validation. But no such was given, his father had told him that he would leave, Internally Janus began doubting himself until he heard his brother call out to him outside.

Upon finding his brother on the tree’s they would normally play at, his brother offered Ice cream and said that it’s for the times he cared for him and to pay some of it back, but noticing something going on Janus explained with Garmal a bit confused he tried to have Janus feel better by asking for a promise.

“Can you smile when you’re with me? Just so I can believe, just for a little while- That everything will be ok?”

Chapter 3: The Vein That Split

While alone in the house, Janus heard a knock. Hearing unfamiliar voices speaking through the doors. A series of questions began for Janus asking who these strangers are. He had even asked them to leave him and his brother alone; Words were spoken and actions were casted on both sides with them breaking in and them wrangling both Janus and his brother, desperate he tried defending his brother but due to his lack of strength failed to do so.

One with a plague doctor mask went to look for his father, meanwhile the accomplice had more sinister plans for the children. Janus struggled the entire time. He kept speaking fighting words to intimidate them into letting them go, but internally he was horrified of what might happen.

Chapter 4: Stillwater


Floating weightlessly in what he imagines to be a void of sorts, his body felt numb, weak even; like it doesn't want to move anymore. He mentally however wanted to keep going, he did not want to die here.

With a Ragged Gasp he found himself awakened once more with the place cleared out except his brother's body. After staring at it for ages he slowly went to move the body up the snowy hill where he and his brother played, then he buried him. He sat against the tree staring at the spot he buried his brother, feeling like he truly failed, and that without a word, he believes that he can’t do anything right.

To right whatever wrong he can, He slowly goes to move out on his journey to try and find a type of magic that can help his brother; Starting with the single book left by his father relating to Blood Magic.

"

name: Tempus
backstory:
"

Chapter 1- Tao of Gold

Within the confines of the Astral Vail, Tempus was the more bitter of the two brothers. Unlike his brother Tempore, His brother was far more talented at magic than him, along with more kindness. Despite being the weaker of the two he worked for everything with effort and ambition. Though he never resented his brother, in fact he cares deeply for his brother. The Vail itself had much to do and to train their very magical capabilities.
Tempus always, day and restless nights worked on practical methods as well as learning to hone his psionic magic effectively, stubborn as he was, ambition born fruit with him learning to use magic to his own whim, magic that he can call his own. Once he presented that he too can be like his brother, his brother smiled.

Chapter 2- Taijí of Silver


As Both Brothers Spar, on the sidelines their mentor watches, Tempus loss after loss with frustration apparent with his brother being triumphant each time. Despite each loss though, his brother would always lend an open hand to his brother after the spar.
Tempus always felt humiliated, and despite him learning more about magic from his Mentor Ẕ̴͇͖̈́̂̌̅é̸̪̞̤͔̊̃̈́͂̆̚͠r̸̡̼̘͍̳̺̝̖̩̎͐̅͊̓o̸͔͇͕͈̞̱͓̱̟͓̊̍͒̑ͅ he would wonder what has been lacking. He understands that he is the weaker brother but his effort is worth more than what he believes.
Wanting answers, while his Mentor praises his brother and spends more time with him, Tempus goes off into the place his mentor spends most of his time. Amongst the items he finds files, papers that pique his curiosity raising new ideas that he didn’t figure was possible. Perhaps with those files and theories he can truly impress his mentor with the theory about Demi-planes he found Regarding an individual known as the \"First Herrscher\"

Chapter 3- Yin & Yang of Purple


Upon a field with two big trees watching, Tempus creates a ritual circle with materials he had accumulated for this ritual to work. There had been some doubt that he would be capable of doing this, that he would fail as he always failed before. It had made sense, his brother the Golden child essentially of the two would always be praised for essentially doing nothing and Tempus more left on the sideline due to his “rebellious” nature. Casted those useless emotions aside, he began the ritual.

Half way through the ritual, he heard his Brothers and Mentor’s voice, one of worry and the other of almost anger. He was too far into the ritual to stop it now, but with both approaching tempus tries to stop their advances. During the scuffle something within the Ritual went wrong. It felt like the world itself was rupturing with a portal opening, clouds forming around the very area they find themselves in.

The portal pulls both him and his brother in with his mentor standing his ground. During the fall he had lost sight of his brother with whatever place he found himself in falling. Reaching out to grab anything at all, he saw Gold…Then Silver, Each time he reached but failed to grab hold of. When he thought hope was lost and realization set in that he has done something terrible; seeing something near the depth of whatever chasm he found himself in saw a purple shape.

He reached his hand out in one last attempt.

"

name: Lute
backstory:
"

Chapter 1: Petals in the Sacred Dance


In a peaceful town on the outskirts of Hemlock in the country of Mondral a young girl in the name of Lute Celestara grew up in a church. Without proper parents and no sign of who their parents are. She was raised to be a church girl who was an awfully kind and peaceful soul.

She had always taken reading seriously, despite being in a church which follows Lord death, she takes it upon herself to learn about each and every god, demi-god to her best capabilities.
Within a small field that once was barren with dead grass and lifeless trees a Priestess had watched Lute tend to the barren land.
Within a few months when the priestess decided to check on the barren land. She came across Lute dancing and singing with a field filled with flowers and fluorescent grass that glistens in the sunlight.

Chapter 2: Reverence in Motion


In recent years, Lute has grown to be a sort of idol amongst not just in the church but to the locals as this singer who isn't quite a priestess but also a wonderful singer whom people actually began to adore and showed up for church despite them only being there for the performances.

The Clergy began theorizing that Lute herself was using them for her own gain; Although Lute had not realized it at first, she carried on day to day life with brightness in her eyes.
Multiple attempts have been made to poison lute with her own flowers that she tends.
With more failures their attempts became more sloppy. With Lute eventually finding out after a series of attempts, decides it would be best to leave in the middle of the night.

Chapter 3: Petalwaltz


During one of her lonesome performances in the forest, an unexpected Lady in the name of Iris appeared from the forest, having stopped briefly to hear such a performance. After Lutes performance she had finally noticed Iris, a little bewildered that someone would be this deep in the forest. After a brief conversation it appeared the two had gone along with Lute following Iris to a place called the \"Intelligentsia Guild”.

Thanks to Iris, Lute was able to temporarily get a job as a sort of messenger. The look on Lute’s Aloof face looked harmless enough, she was to be used to transport messages. However, after some time had passed she was tasked to give an envelope to someone, Lute would always read the Envelope and burn it so only she can remember and transfer the information more safely as she is clumsy with losing possessions.
Though the letter that she read was so shocking to her and haunting, she burnt the letter and left the guild during her mission.

Chapter 4: One Who Walks a Half-Step Behind—and Asks Me to Dance


Lute had begun growing a career as a singer and dancer for the masses. One instance was when she went to Orange Coral for a party. Though security being tight, she had assumed it was for primarily her safety from Shady Individuals.

Tragedy struck when Portals began opening holes in the sky with Monsters raining down. Lute Initially panicked like the rest of the crowd seeing the disorder and not having the Agency attempt to pray, during her prayer she sees a lady named Ina who was taking control and leading crowds away from danger. She had almost instinctively followed Ina’s words; But realizing that her and Ina are similar but in different circumstances.
Lute had begun helping Ina with introductions set and a goal to help as many people as she can.

Chapter 5: Scattered Petals


In her sleep a memory is formed, though she cannot dream she felt like she had seen this before..she cannot see within whatever realm she's in, Feelings of flowers are on her eyes and her face, neck, even arms. She can feel like she is being held by something, either warm or cold with a voice speaking to her in sadness as she lays there weak. Without her knowledge she began speaking. “______…wont..you..smile…For me?”...sniffling can be heard from the male “Lute…I..” Her mouth would begin moving on her own again saying “Please…Wont..Last….Long”

The male would compose themselves slowly as tears drip onto her face “yeah.. I’m smiling Sweetheart…Im..Smiling”. Lute could feel her mouth open, muttering words that even she cannot understand. “Hm..? Can you…Say that again..I didnt…Quite catch that…”

"

name: Avarice
backstory:
"Kavir was raised under the shadow of his fathers debts.  Through no fault of his own he was punished daily for crimes that were not his.  Kavir watched helplessly as his fathers life was siphoned away in order to pay off an unfair and ever increasing debt.  Seeing his father fight for his life in the fighting pits while crowds of crazed gamblers bet on each bruise and broken bone changed something deep inside Kavir.  At a young age he knew well the poison that was greedand how thoroughly it corrupted those he knew were supposed to be good. Despite hesitation to serve the people who treated his father this way, he ended up carrying out tasks for the guild that suited his skillset. Kavir was nimble in a crowd and his knowledge of alleyways and the sewer system made evading capture easy when stealing from targets he was assigned. By day he honed his ability to disappear, while at night he would practice picking the series of locks between him and his father. The guild quickly took note of this behavior but turned a blind eye and changed the locks frequently while increasing the difficulty of each to improve his skills silently.

Years later his father had passed away and Kavir took on the name Avarice and swore he would use the name to kill those that took his father from him. He reached his breaking point soon after Devotion passed away, at which point he cut sawed off both of his horns and slipped out of the city in a caravan. The next years challenged him to build a criminal reputation that could keep him fed while not alerting anyone that could recapture him of his location. Sleep was out of reach for a very long time, his paranoia fueling him past most other peoples limits. Eventually he had built a web of personas and names that he began to demonstrate his skills. He quickly became a thorn in the Side of a particularly powerful and twisted individual, Herta took action quickly and became a sole provider of contracts for Avarice. He worked his way up the ranks, nearly joining the infamous ghost squadron.  When the organization he served began falling apart he cut ties and ran away with his last assignment, ordered to keep her safe. 

"

name: Tempore
backstory:
"

Chapter 1: The Source and Harmony

Vibrant colors go back and forth within the Astral Veil, With a Dragonborn in the name of Tempore lies. Ever since at a young age, he has had the gift of a strong, healthy body along with the gift of ever growing magic that in raw power was unmatched, though he never used it for wrong-doing. He used it as a source to nurture those that need help.
Unlike his brother Tempus who is not as gifted in him, he would always praise his own brother for his thinking, In fact he could even say he envied his strong resolve on wanting to grow and not be complacent.
He would have been content to be the way that he is, but seeing such will from his brother, it made him also want to grow as a person himself.

Chapter 2: Moment of Division


Sounds of spells can be heard being casted. “Again.” was said by the Brother’s Mentor Ẕ̴͇͖̈́̂̌̅é̸̪̞̤͔̊̃̈́͂̆̚͠r̸̡̼̘͍̳̺̝̖̩̎͐̅͊̓o̸͔͇͕͈̞̱͓̱̟͓̊̍͒̑ͅ.
Tempore doesn’t quite understand as to why this person stayed with the two brothers with the claim that they had much potential. In fact, it bothered him that he was more praised for his natural talent compared to his brother's pure effort.
Though he never disliked it, In fact he actually quite enjoyed it, he saw their mentor as a sort of father figure. Seemed to always support what he does with a guiding hand.
He had even taken cooking which he was excellent at, though he was told to not do it often as it “Neglected training”. What kind of training except teaching him things about the outside world, as well as using Magic to harm others; even his own brother when they spar. With a heavy heart does so but always prefers to heal than to harm.

Chapter 3: Dynamic Balance

Tempore began flying as fast as he could. He was told by his mentor that his brother, his only family, began doing something reckless. He was attempting to open a portal, he never quite understood the details at the time as he was more worried about his brother. Doubt came to him if he had been neglecting his own brother too much, maybe jealousy came to Tempus that caused him to do what he’s doing.
The moment both intercepted his brother, they had successfully disrupted the ritual that he had been making. Though, one moment he saw a portal open. Everything around them began falling apart like shards crumbling, he was pulled into the portal along with his brother leaving their mentor behind.
As he was falling, he tried his best to reach out to his brother, but a sudden gap opened where he began falling down, and ended up in a newfound place unknown to him.
Stranded and alone he wonders to find where his brother went; along with regaining contact with his mentor and to help him right whatever wrong his brother could have potentially done.
